properties.areaDesc: Curry County; Chaves County Plains; Roosevelt County
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 4 at 2:19PM MST until February 5 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...MORE SNOW EXPECTED FOR CENTRAL AND EASTERN NEW MEXICO...

.A storm system has delivered wintry weather to much of central
and eastern New Mexico through at least this evening. Eight to 10
inches of snowfall will occur across the mountain peaks and west
facing slopes while around 2 to 6 inches will fall in the high
valleys, eastern highlands and plains. Temperatures will stay
below freezing today which will cause roadways to become icy and
snowpacked, including along the I-25 corridor from Santa Fe to
Raton Pass as well as other mountain passes and I-40 from the east
mountain communities to the Texas border.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6
inches.

* WHERE...Curry County, Roosevelt County and Chaves County
Plains.

* WHEN...Until 6 AM MST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on icy and snow covered road conditions. The
hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of falling and blowing snow
will reduce visibility below 1 mile.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST WEDNESDAY
